episodeTitle: Shanks Makes a Move! The Linchpin to the Reckless Era!
episodeTitleJapanese: シャンクス動く！暴走する時代への楔
episodeTitleRomaji: Shankusu Ugoku! Bōsōsuru Jidai e no Kusabi
description: Shanks meets with Whitebeard to warn him about Ace pursuing Blackbeard, resulting in an epic clash that splits the sky. Meanwhile, at Water 7, the Franky Family learns they've been left out of the official reports while Franky and Iceberg begin constructing the Straw Hats' new ship.

events.title: Five Elders Learn of Shanks-Whitebeard Meeting
events.description: The Five Elders are informed that the Whitebeard Pirates and the Red Hair Pirates have broken through the Marine's defenses and are about to meet. The World Government views this meeting as a serious threat.
events.significance: Demonstrates the immense power and influence of the Yonko, showing that even the World Government cannot prevent their actions when they are determined.

events.title: Shanks Boards the Moby Dick
events.description: Shanks arrives on Whitebeard's ship, the Moby Dick, to have an important discussion with the legendary pirate. The Red Hair Pirates and Whitebeard Pirates meet face to face.
events.significance: This rare meeting between two Yonko sets the stage for one of the most iconic moments in One Piece, showcasing the immense power these individuals possess.

events.title: Shanks Demonstrates Conqueror's Haki
events.description: As Shanks walks across the Moby Dick, multiple members of the Whitebeard Pirates faint from the sheer force of his Conqueror's Haki. Shanks apologizes, explaining it's hard to stay calm on an enemy ship. Marco and Jozu observe the display with recognition of Shanks' incredible power.
events.significance: This is one of the first major demonstrations of Conqueror's Haki in the series, establishing it as a rare and powerful ability possessed only by the strongest individuals. It also showcases Shanks' supreme strength even among Yonko.

quotes.text: Sorry about that. It's hard to stay calm on an enemy ship.
quotes.speaker: Shanks
quotes.context: Shanks apologizes after his Conqueror's Haki causes Whitebeard's crew members to faint

quotes.text: Shanks' Haki is as strong as ever.
quotes.speaker: Jozu
quotes.context: Jozu comments on the display of Conqueror's Haki

events.title: Shanks and Whitebeard Share Sake
events.description: Shanks presents Whitebeard with sake from the West Blue. The two legendary pirates share a drink and discuss their shared history, including their memories of Gol D. Roger and Buggy.
events.significance: This moment shows the respect and camaraderie that can exist even between rival Yonko, and reinforces their connection to the previous Pirate King era.

quotes.text: You've made quite a leap as a pirate since Gol D. Roger's death.
quotes.speaker: Whitebeard
quotes.context: Whitebeard acknowledges Shanks' rise to power over the past 22 years

events.title: Shanks Reveals the Origin of His Scar
events.description: Shanks reveals that the scar across his left eye was given to him by Marshall D. Teach (Blackbeard), a former member of Whitebeard's crew. He emphasizes that he wasn't being careless when he received it, highlighting Blackbeard's dangerous nature.
events.significance: This revelation establishes Blackbeard as a serious threat, showing that he was powerful enough to scar one of the Yonko before he even obtained his Devil Fruit powers. It also explains a visual detail about Shanks that has been present since the beginning of the series.

quotes.text: This scar... it came from a member of your crew. Marshall D. Teach.
quotes.speaker: Shanks
quotes.context: Shanks reveals who gave him his iconic facial scar

events.title: Shanks Requests Whitebeard Stop Ace's Pursuit
events.description: Shanks asks Whitebeard to call back Portgas D. Ace from his pursuit of Blackbeard, warning that the confrontation will lead to disaster. He emphasizes that Blackbeard is more dangerous than Whitebeard realizes and that Ace is not ready to face him.
events.significance: This is the central purpose of Shanks' visit and serves as critical foreshadowing for the Marineford War. Shanks, with his ability to see the bigger picture, recognizes the catastrophic chain of events that Ace's pursuit will trigger.

quotes.text: Stop Ace. Don't let him go after Teach.
quotes.speaker: Shanks
quotes.context: Shanks makes his request to Whitebeard

events.title: Whitebeard Refuses Shanks' Request
events.description: Whitebeard angrily refuses Shanks' request, declaring that Blackbeard must pay for killing a crewmate (Thatch), whom he considered a son. He states that this is a matter of pride and family honor that he cannot ignore.
events.significance: Whitebeard's refusal sets in motion the events that will lead to the Summit War at Marineford. This decision ultimately costs him his life and changes the balance of power in the world. It demonstrates Whitebeard's unwavering loyalty to his 'sons' even when it may not be strategically wise.

quotes.text: Blackbeard needs to learn his lesson. He killed one of my sons!
quotes.speaker: Whitebeard
quotes.context: Whitebeard explains why he cannot accept Shanks' request

events.title: The Sky-Splitting Clash of Two Yonko
events.description: After Whitebeard refuses his request, Shanks draws his sword and warns that the world will be thrown into chaos. The two Yonko clash their weapons, and the sheer force of their Conqueror's Haki collision creates an enormous gash across the sky, literally splitting the heavens. The Whitebeard Pirates watch in awe as the clouds part from the impact.
events.significance: This is the first time the sky-splitting phenomenon appears in the One Piece anime, establishing a visual representation of what happens when two users of advanced Conqueror's Haki clash. This iconic moment sets the standard for depicting the strongest clashes in the series and demonstrates the godlike power possessed by the Yonko. It also cements Conqueror's Haki as one of the most important powers in the One Piece world.

quotes.text: The world will be thrown into chaos!
quotes.speaker: Shanks

events.title: Franky Family Excluded from Official Report
events.description: The Franky Family discovers from the newspaper that they have been completely omitted from the official World Government report about the Enies Lobby incident, while the Straw Hats are blamed for everything.
events.significance: This demonstrates the World Government's manipulation of information and their desire to minimize the appearance of a widespread rebellion. It also shows their fear of the truth about Enies Lobby spreading.

events.title: Straw Hats Learn Their Bounties Will Increase
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates learn from the newspaper that since the World Government is blaming only them for the destruction of Enies Lobby, all of their bounties are going to increase. Robin suspects Admiral Aokiji's involvement in keeping the Franky Family out of the report.
events.significance: This sets up the upcoming bounty reveals and shows how the World Government's propaganda serves to increase the Straw Hats' notoriety. It also hints at Aokiji's complex relationship with the crew.

events.title: Construction of the Thousand Sunny Begins
events.description: Franky and Iceberg, along with the Galley-La Company shipwrights, begin serious construction on the Straw Hats' new ship. Luffy learns about the ship being built for the crew.
events.significance: This marks the beginning of the construction of the Thousand Sunny, which will become the Straw Hats' new home and vessel for the rest of their journey.

events.title: Nami Discovers Money Shortage
events.description: Nami becomes frustrated when she learns that Luffy has spent their 100 million berry fund on the celebration party and food, leaving them with insufficient funds for the ship's furnishings.
events.significance: A comedic moment that highlights Luffy's carefree nature with money and Nami's role as the crew's financial manager, while also creating a practical problem they'll need to solve.

themes.description: The episode heavily foreshadows the upcoming Marineford War through Shanks' warning and Whitebeard's refusal. Despite Shanks' wisdom and foresight, fate seems inevitable.
themes.symbolism: The sky splitting represents the breaking point between the old era and the chaos to come.

themes.description: Whitebeard's refusal to stop Ace stems from his view of his crew as family and his need to avenge Thatch's death, even when it may lead to disaster.
themes.symbolism: The unwavering bond of the Whitebeard Pirates as a family unit.

themes.description: The meeting showcases the immense power of the Yonko and their connection to the previous generation through Gol D. Roger. The sky-splitting clash demonstrates power beyond normal comprehension.
themes.symbolism: The sky split visually represents the clash between titans and the rupture in the world's balance.

characterSpotlights.role: Primary protagonist attempting to prevent disaster
characterSpotlights.development: We see Shanks as a wise and powerful figure who can see the bigger picture of world events. His concern for the future and attempt to prevent the coming war shows his maturity and strategic thinking.

trivia.fact: This episode features the first sky-splitting clash in the One Piece anime, establishing the visual representation of advanced Conqueror's Haki clashes that would become iconic in later arcs.
The episode aired on July 1, 2007 in Japan and received a TV rating of 9.1% (Rank 6), showing its popularity with viewers.
This episode corresponds to manga chapters 433-435, specifically pages 433 p.19, 434 p.2-17, and 435 p.2-7.
Despite Shanks' warning in this episode, Whitebeard's refusal sets in motion the events that lead to the Summit War at Marineford, one of the most significant arcs in One Piece.
This was the first major demonstration of Conqueror's Haki affecting multiple people at once, with several Whitebeard Pirates fainting from Shanks' presence alone.
